newsitem.title: USA: First Midwest takes SAIF charge, plans shr buyback.
newsitem.headline: First Midwest takes SAIF charge, plans shr buyback.

text.p: First Midwest Financial Inc, said Friday it took a charge of $795,000, or $0.44 a share, against its fiscal 1996 fourth-quarter earnings to recapitalize the Savings Association Insurance Fund (SAIF).
First Midwest is an Iowa savings and loan holding company with $388 million in assets.

Earlier Friday, First Midwest said its earnings for its fourth quarter ended September 30 were $813,000, or $0.45 a share, excluding the charge. The provision reduced First Midwest's per share net income to $0.01.
In the comparable period of fiscal 1995, net income totaled $732,000 or $0.41.
In another development, First Midwest said its directors authorized the company to repurchase of up to 150,000 shares of its 1.8 million common shares outstanding.

First Midwest said it intended to repurchase the shares, depending upon market conditions, from time to time over a 12 month period. The shares will be used for general corporate purposes, including stock-based benefit plans.
